J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>Ignore everything except the stored procedures. To test those, you can 
>use something like DbUnit and call the stored procedures from JDBC.
>
>  
>
I've tried DBUnit, but I found that it's valuable only when I have huge 
datasets to be compared, inserted etc. Most of the time, I use easyMock 
for mocking the database access layer, and test it separately with plain 
database set/get methods.

Vamsee.
subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and Spring framework
